item.title: Tools for Causal Inference
item.description: There is enough motivation now showing the necessity of learning models that have a correct causal structure. The famous “Correlation is not causation” quote should ring a bell. Although the research on learning causal structure from observed data has not yet shown its potential. There are certain tasks from causal literature which can still be solved by just using observed data. Specifically, interventional and counterfactual queries can still be answered if we know the causal structure.
